title: What do you guys think of this font?
content:
This is something I created for a type class a few years ago. When I was making it I was about half way through and the professor told me to ditch it. I did, but I'm stubborn so I finished it off after the class. Its just been sitting on my computer since then. The other day I noticed it and I kind of like it, but I'm still unsure what to make of it to be honest. What do you guys think?

[http://i6.photobucket.com/albums/y239/Jumpsuit/scalion-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150416034833/http:/i6.photobucket.com/albums/y239/Jumpsuit/scalion-1.jpg "http://i6.photobucket.com/albums/y239/Jumpsuit/scalion-1.jpg")
author: A-type

comments.content:
Interesting texture which makes a 3D effect, but you should keep the same perspective. It's not a good idea to turn the a upside down to form an e. Shorten the upper end of the t. Otherwise, an interesting typeface, no reason to ditch it. Well - I'm not quite convinced of the small bowls of p, o, g etc.

Andreas

PS: same problem like a/e with p and d - and I forgot to mention the m.

Thanks for the feedback Andreas. You gave me flash backs. heh, this was done in illustrator and I was so tired of doing the line work the e was the last letter and I just said screw it, and flipped the a over to call it good. I agree about the bowls of the p, o, and g. If I was going to revisit (which I could depending on the feedback) I'd adjust those letters, amongst others.
